content:
If hobbits didn't live under hills, they might like this homey structure that seems to fit right into its surroundings. It calls forth visions of a simpler world in keeping with nature and is one of sculptor 
 150 amazing 
 installations that have sprung up all around the world to the wonderment of passersby since 1982. 
Says curator Linda Johnson: 
Be prepared to transport yourself to another world.
This one looks like an elven dwelling nestled in a protective mountain range:
With the pull of a twig or the whisper of a magical phrase, these 'buildings' might lead you into another realm:
And these look like comfy places to rest your head after a long day's hike:
Check out Patrick Dougherty's site at 
 to see more images of his amazing work. Unless otherwise noted, all images are via Dougherty's web site.
title: Patrick Dougherty's Incredible Nest Houses
